requirements.summary: Add a copy/paste-friendly, file-by-file repository listing format developers can use to recreate the project locally.
acceptanceCriteria: The chat output includes BOTH the frontend and backend code for the project.
The code is organized file-by-file, where each file output clearly indicates the exact relative path (e.g., `backend/main.mo`, `frontend/src/App.tsx`) followed by the full file contents.
The file listing is complete enough that a developer can reconstruct the repository locally and run it using the existing documented commands.
Any user-facing text included in the delivered code/files or instructions is in English.

file_operations.description: Create documentation that specifies the exact, copy/paste-friendly file-by-file format to deliver complete repository code in chat (including both frontend and backend file paths and contents), plus guidance for verifying completeness against the repository structure. Keep all user-facing text in English.

Add a short section referencing frontend/docs/CHAT_EXPORT_FORMAT.md as the canonical file-by-file listing format for chat-based delivery (Basic-plan alternative), without changing any application behavior/UI.
Add a documentation link/reference to frontend/docs/CHAT_EXPORT_FORMAT.md so developers can find the chat-based export format quickly. Ensure text is in English.

requirements.summary: Add step-by-step local reconstruction and run instructions tailored to pasting files from chat, including env setup from existing .env example files and copy-paste commands.
acceptanceCriteria: Instructions include where to create folders/files, how to verify the directory structure matches the provided paths, and how to paste contents safely.

Instructions reference the existing example env files (e.g., `frontend/.env.example`, `frontend/.env.development.example`, `frontend/.env.staging.example`) and explain how to create the real `.env` file(s) from them.
Instructions include copy-paste-ready commands to install dependencies and start the frontend and backend for local development.
All instruction text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a step-by-step guide for reconstructing the repo locally from chat-pasted files, including: creating folders/files per paths, verifying directory structure, safe paste tips, dependency install commands, and run commands. Include explicit references to frontend/.env.example, frontend/.env.development.example, and frontend/.env.staging.example and how to create the real .env files from them. Keep all instruction text in English.

Add a section that links to frontend/docs/CHAT_RECONSTRUCTION_GUIDE.md and clarifies that it is the preferred guide when the repo is delivered via chat, reusing existing documented commands and env-file conventions.

Ensure existing task labels/commands are accurately referenced by the new chat reconstruction guide (and update task descriptions/labels only if needed for clarity), without changing application runtime behavior.
